description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5mhc","text":"This protocol uses a CRISPR RNP complex and nucleofection to precisely knock out genes. LUHMES cells, derived from human fetal mesencephalic tissue, offer a valuable model for studying dopaminergic dysfunction, featuring stimulus-induced dopamine release, relevant electrophysiological traits, and unique dopaminergic markers validating their phenotypic relevance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1atrp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fkqe","text":"LUHMES Cell Line: (ATCC Catalog Number: CRL-2927)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al0o7","text":"Nucleofection kit:  P3 Primary Cell 4D-Nucleofector X Kit S Catalog #V4XP-3032","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: LUHMES,Ribonucleoprotein Complex (RNP),CRISPR /Cas9 knockout in neurons,Gene knockout in dopaminergic cells,Neurodegenerative disease models

With 8.5 μL from the same stock, it introduces 527 pmol. The final Alt-R Cas9 concentration in a 125 μL volume is approximately 4.216 μM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hmjj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqn62","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","Lonza Single Nucleocuvette  (100uL)","Lonza Nucleocuvette strip (20uL)"],"colWidths":["221","253","243"],"data":[["pmaxGFP Vector (0.5ug/uL)","Add 4uL ","Add 1.2 uL"],["Nucleofection solution (P3)","82 uL ","16.4 uL "],["Nucleofection supplement (P3)","18 uL","3.6 uL"],["Amount of cells","~ 1.3 million","~500,000 cells"]],"guid":"E5856D0257CA44AB9E95A61E70431738","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["pmaxGFP Vector (0.5ug/uL)","Add 4uL ","Add 1.2 uL"],["Nucleofection solution (P3)","82 uL ","16.4 uL "],["Nucleofection supplement (P3)","18 uL","3.6 uL"],["Amount of cells","~ 1.3 million","~500,000 cells"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"8345B666E78C40D1BF3A43C7A2F9523C","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"P3 Primary Cell 4D-Nucleofector X Kit S  ","rrid":"","sku":"V4XP-3032","url":"http://","vendor":{"id":127,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://www.lonza.com/","name":"Lonza"}}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"C2B70DB2BAFB433D934599CCDE4EC853","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Alt-R S.p. status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"frid3","text":"Maintain a cell confluency of 70–85%. Higher cell densities may lead to lower Nucleofection efficiencies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2chci","text":"Coat a new 6-well plate freshly with poly-L-ornithine and fibronectin to facilitate LUHMES attachment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t07n","text":"Rinse LUHMES cells with 1XPBS, then add   to dissociate the cells, using 4 mL in a T-75 flask, and incubate for 3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"49e5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"05D398338E1F4271870B4CB8D81764F6","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"trypsin-EDTA (TE)","rrid":"","sku":"R001100","url":"http://","vendor":{"id":31,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Fisher Scientific"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11a8j","text":"Spin at 1200 revolutions per minute (rpm) in a centrifuge for 5 minutes, then carefully discard the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"avtkp","text":"Re-suspend cells with 5 mL of 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kbfe","text":"Carefully re-suspend each cell pellet in room temperature 4D-Nucleofection Solution + supplement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f12p3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6l6o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aj7dj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":72.76363636363637,"id":453966,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"p5kdb6697.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5ksb6697.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5kqb6697.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5krb6697.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5kpb6697.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14qi5","text":"Add cells to the cuvette, ensuring the sample covers the bottom of the cuvette. Gently tap to distribute evenly and avoid bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cemhk","text":"Replace the existing media with warmed fresh media, followed by an incubation period of 10 to 15 minutes at room temperature or in an appropriate incubator. Avoid any disturbance to the cells post-nucleofection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f7qmp","text":"A typical analysis time is 24-hours post-nucleofection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"131ec","text":"During centrifugation, prepare RNP complex while setting up Nucleofector 4D. Choose plate layout, program, and cell type (e.g., single cuvette or strip). Employ LUHMES program CA-137.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds67m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kkbl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fpagj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":102,"id":453970,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1j9pp\",\"text\":\"RNP Complex\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"p5kbb6697.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5kwb6697.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5kub6697.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5kvb6697.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p5ktb6697.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0qoa","text":"Place the nucleocuvettes in the nucleofector cuvette holder, ensuring proper alignment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36bg1","text":"Following the coating process, add LUHMES growth media to the 6-well plate and pre-incubate/equilibrate the plates in a humidified incubator set at 37°C with 5% CO2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5iors","text":"Following cell counting, aliquot cells into separate 15 mL tubes, adding around 1.3 million cells per cuvette and 500,000 cells per well in a nucleocuvette strip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cbr5f","text":"Centrifuge the samples a second time at a low speed (90xg) for 10 minutes, ensuring minimal cell agitation before nucleofection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch61b","text":"Add the Snap cap tube to fridge over night in   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5u5li","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4ic4","text":"24 hours after nucleofection, rinse the cells using 1X PBS, apply TE dissociation solution, allow a 3-minute incubation period, transfer to a 15 mL tube, and then centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnlhd","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6d586","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j4nq","text":"Re-suspend the cells in 1X lysis buffer, gently triturating approximately 5 times to ensure efficient cell membrane disruption and DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhjhm","text":"                  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9rek","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a21ki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"71DF3F0C982843B7BD091FF010D36374","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Lysis Buffer 1X Working solution","rrid":"","sku":"635013","url":"http://","vendor":{"id":1203,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.takarabio.com/","name":"Takara Bio Inc."}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"en743","text":"Excessive trituration can result in increased shearing of DNA","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5s475","text":"Add the 1.5 mL snap cap tube to a  heat block for 15 minutes to disrupt cellular structures, denature proteins, and aid DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ugun","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"65","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frudt","text":"Follow with a second heat treatment at   for 3 minutes to further denature DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fuluf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"95","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cqtl1","text":"Add cell suspension to a 1.5 mL snap cap tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g5nf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avger","text":"Prepare the PCR reaction mix in a sterile microcentrifuge tube by combining the following components:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lrfm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68v7a","text":"Template DNA: The DNA you wish to amplify, need ~100 ng of DNA per 25uL reaction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8og","text":"Forward and Reverse Primers: Short DNA sequences that bind to the start and end of the target DNA region you want to copy.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ji1s","text":"MyTaq Red Mix (Meridian Life Science Catalog #CSA-01178): A ready-to-use PCR master mix containing DNA polymerase, dNTPs, buffer, and a red dye.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2oq8t","text":"DMSO (Dimethyl Sulfoxide):  Added to enhance PCR specificity and amplification of GC-rich templates","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ur6e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i242","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"43chr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ivnp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Components","Concentrations","1","20"],"colWidths":["182","193","114","68"],"data":[["Forward Primer (100uM)","0.5 μM ","0.125 μL","2.5 μL"],["Reverse Primer (100uM)","0.5 μM","0.125 μL","2.5 μL"],["MyTaq (DNA Polymerase)","2X","12.5","250 uL "],["DMSO","5% ","1.25 μL per reaction.","25 μL "],["Water (ddH2O)","amount depends on the remaining volume after adding the other components","9 uL","180 uL"],["","","",""],["Template DNA","need ~200 ng per 25uL reaction","2 uL","2 uL"],["Total ","",""]],"guid":"3C41C2FF93624896BC17D30538DF7F4F","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2kf2t","text":"PCR1 components","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{"A_6":[4,1],"B_8":[3,1]},"printData":[["Forward Primer (100uM)","0.5 μM ","0.125 μL","2.5 μL"],["Reverse Primer (100uM)","0.5 μM","0.125 μL","2.5 μL"],["MyTaq (DNA Polymerase)","2X","12.5","250 uL "],["DMSO","5% ","1.25 μL per reaction.","25 μL "],["Water (ddH2O)","amount depends on the remaining volume after adding the other components","9 uL","180 uL"],["","","",""],["Template DNA","need ~200 ng per 25uL reaction","2 uL","2 uL"],["Total amount","25 uL ","",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,43,8,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4usvr","text":"Utilize a nanodrop device to determine the nucleic acid concentration of your bulk sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
